intro: Corydalis eugeniae subsp. fissibracteata, commonly known as the fissibracteate corydalis, is a member of the Fumariaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, often blue or purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive, narrow bracts that are typically split or fissured, giving it its specific epithet. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms in spring or early summer.
